After working with Inori and Maika to get Akane\nfired up again, the passing days had been so\npleasant.%K%P
'That's it for today.'%K%P
I closed the book I was reading and stretched.%K%P
The book recommended to me by Inori was\nunexpectedly good, time just zoomed passed.%K%P
'Better get some coffee.'%K%P
'Oh, Inori?'%K%P
'Sho?'%K%P
When I entered the living room, Inori looked\nserious, deep in thought.%K%P
'Did something happen?'%K%P
'Oh, well... I-It's nothing.'%K%P
She must have been thinking really hard since\nshe didn't notice me until I spoke to her.%K%P
Because of that, she hurried to put a smile on\nher face.%K%P
'Are you concerned about something?'%K%P
'There is something on my mind, but it's nothing\nyou need to worry about, Sho.'%K%P
It was unusual for Inori to hide things like\nthat.%K%P
It made me curious.%K%P
'Ah, seems like you don't trust me, Inori...\nWhen I trust you so much.'%K%P
'What?! No, That's not true! I trust you, Sho!'%K%P
'Then, tell me what's bothering you.'%K%P
'Oh, u-um...'%K%P
'See? You really don't...'%K%P
'O-Okay! I'll tell you!'%K%P
Whatever the situation, Inori was always nice.%K%P
'So, what's been bothering you?'%K%P
'Akane is very close to the people of Kannagi,\nright?'%K%P
'Hmm? Yeah, it sure seems like it.'%K%P
We'd been hearing stories during dinner about\nAkane's interactions with the people of the\nshopping street.%K%P
From what I heard, she had a very close\nrelationship with them.%K%P
'After hearing those stories, I can't help but\nto think this.'%K%P
'I am the goddess of Kannagi Town, but it's not\nlike I'm close with its people like Akane is.'%K%P
'That's why I was thinking of ways to be more\nhelpful for the people of Kannagi.'%K%P
After she released all her pent up feelings, she\ntook a sip of her tea and let out a sigh.%K%P
'Do you feel contempt towards me being jealous\nof Akane?'%K%P
'Why would I feel contempt?'%K%P
'You care so much about this town. I admire that\nand will never feel contempt for you.'%K%P
'Sho...'%K%P
'From what you said, it sounds like you want to\nbe more involved with the people of this town.'%K%P
'Y-Yes. That's true. But, I just don't know what\nto do...'%K%P
'I'm not cheerful or assertive like Akane...'%K%P
'Hmm...'%K%P
A way to get closer to the townspeople...%K%P
Akane attracted them with her own, unique\npersonality.%K%P
It'd be cruel to make the modest and virtuous\nInori act like her.%K%P
Then, what was the best thing to do?%K%P
'Oh yeah...'%K%P
'Did you think of something?!'%K%P
Whoa, she's really serious about this.%K%P
Surprised to see Inori more active than usual, I\ncleared my throat and stated my suggestion.%K%P
'It's actually very simple. You just have to\nmake a regional contribution.'%K%P
'A regional contribution?'%K%P
Yes. You'll listen and solve the townspeople's\nconcerns. That way, you'll naturally get closer\nto them.'%K%P
Inori made a distressed face upon hearing my\nsuggestion.%K%P
'I appreciate the suggestion Sho, but\nunfortunately, I cannot do that.'%K%P
'You can't?'%K%P
'Yes. Are you familiar with the Divine\nFundamental Law?'%K%P
'Hmm, I'm not too familiar with it.'%K%P
'In short, it prohibits goddesses from making\npeople's wishes come true. People are not\nallowed to utilize goddesses like that.'%K%P
'I'd like to ask you to be aware of that.'%K%P
Hmm, that's interesting.%K%P
There's a high possibility to run into that\nissue with regional contribution.%K%P
'They're that strict about the Divine\nFundamental Law?'%K%P
'No, as long as I don't overdo it with my\npowers, there should be no problem.'%K%P
'There actually are goddesses who use Jinriki on\na regular basis.%K%P
Oh?%K%P
Inori made it seem like it was a very severe\nregulation, but it seems like it's actually not\nthat extreme.%K%P
'Then there shouldn't be any issues, right?'%K%P
'Only if it's used 'normally'.'%K%P
'However, the goddess who's my superior is very\nstrict on laws and regulations.'%K%P
'She is very hard to please and is very strict\nwhen it comes to following them.'%K%P
Ah, it sounded like this goddess was the\nserious, uptight type.%K%P
'Inori, it's not like you want to spread your\nname as the goddess of this region, right?'%K%P
'Right. I'm not looking to be respected like\nthat. I just want all residents to be happy\nliving here.'%K%P
'And if possible, I always want to see their\nsmiles. I believe that's how I should be as a\ngoddess.'%K%P
'I see. Then you can help out as just Inori, not\nas the goddess Inori.'%K%P
'What?'%K%P
'Don't use Jinriki, don't spread the word that\nyou're a goddess. Maybe they'd consider it under\nthese conditions?'%K%P
'Th-That actually sounds possible. No, but...'%K%P
Inori kept mumbling as she digested the\nsituation.%K%P
I was aware that I made an awful argument.%K%P
But I strongly felt that this was a great way\nfor Inori to interact with the townspeople.%K%P
'I understand that your superior is strict, but\nI think it's worth a try rather than giving up\noff the bat.'%K%P
'Heck, I'll even go with you to ask.'%K%P
'Sho... I got it. I'll give it a try.'%K%P
'I-It got approved.'%K%P
She muttered in surprise after she came back\nfrom meeting with her boss.%K%P
'That's great. Now you can go ahead with helping\nout the townspeople.'%K%P
'Yes! But, what should I do about the regional\ncontribution...'%K%P
'I'm the one who suggested it. So let's come up\nwith ideas together.'%K%P
I confidently said to reassure Inori.%K%P
'Yes! Let's think of a way together!'%K%P
